conversations.content: What factors contribute to a company's success in the insurance industry, given the lack of traditional competitive advantages?

In my view, it's the people - the individual managers - who make a significant difference in the insurance business. The nature of the industry magnifies their impact on company performance. I feel fortunate to have a talented group of managers associated with us.
How has the investment income of your Insurance Group changed over the past few years?

Our net investment income from the Insurance Group has seen a nice uptick, growing from $8.4 million pre-tax in 1975 to $12.3 million pre-tax in 1977. That's a welcome increase, and we've also realized some capital gains along the way.
